snippet: David Lane, a onetime Bible salesman and self-described former “wild man,” sees his mission as making evangelical Christians a decisive power in the Republican Party.
abstract: Former bible salesman David Lane has undertaken mission to reinvigorate political power of evangelical Christians within Republican Party ahead of 2016 election; has begun traveling around country urging powerful pastors to run for office, in self-described attempt to create political 'army'; observers say Lane represents new generation of evangelicals pushing to resuscitate group disheartened by repeated failure of socially conservative candidates.
lead_paragraph: David Lane, a onetime Bible salesman and self-described former “wild man,” sees his mission as making evangelical Christians a decisive power in the Republican Party.

headline.main: Evangelicals Aim to Mobilize an Army for Republicans in 2016
headline.print_headline: Evangelicals Aim to Mobilize an Army for Republicans in 2016
